profile_data.summary:
I am a Machine Learning Engineer and Data Scientist with a deep passion for AI-driven solutions, Generative AI, NLP, and predictive modeling. Over the past seven years, I have led and contributed to cutting-edge machine learning projects across real estate, retail, finance, healthcare, and technology industries. My expertise lies in developing scalable AI systems, deploying ML models in production, and optimizing MLOps pipelines to drive business impact and automation.

My Expertise Includes:
âœ” Generative AI & NLP â€“ Developing LLMs, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and document classification systems using Hugging Face, LangChain, Azure OpenAI, and Spacy.
âœ” Predictive Analytics & Recommender Systems â€“ Building customer segmentation models, time series forecasting, and collaborative filtering solutions for personalized user experiences.
âœ” Real Estate Data Science â€“ At Realogy, I developed a neural network model to predict sales volume and identify potential franchisees, leveraging PySpark, Databricks, and Spark SQL for data-driven real estate investment insights.
âœ” MLOps & Cloud AI Deployment â€“ Designing end-to-end ML pipelines using AWS, GCP, Databricks, MLflow, and Kubernetes for efficient and scalable model deployment.
âœ” Business Impact & Decision Intelligence â€“ Collaborating with cross-functional teams in marketing, finance, and engineering to turn complex data into actionable strategies.
Industries I Have Worked In:

Real Estate & PropTech | Retail & E-commerce | Travel & Hospitality |  Healthcare & Pharma | ðŸ’¡ Consulting & AI Research
Letâ€™s build the future of AI together!
Email: gozalomoreno@gmail.com
profile_data.headline: Data Scientist, Generative AI, NLP, LLM, MLOPS, Deep Learning, Machine Learning. AI Orchestration & Integration

experience.description:
G4G: Built and deployed open-source document classification systems using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and NLP. Fine-tuned Mistral 7B, Llama 2 with LoRA, QLoRA, and CUDA-optimized inference. Developed vector search pipelines FAISS, ChromaDB, LangChain, AWS Lambda, and  Docker.

Deloitte: I develop advanced natural language processing solutions. Using tools such as Sagemaker, S3, Azure OpenAi, HuggingFace, and Spacy, I classify articles, extract entities, and generate summaries. I communicate with clients to explain proposals, metrics, and requirements for improving solution performance.

Royal Caribbean: I implemented propensity models for identifying prospective customers at a leading American cruise company. Utilized technologies like Pyspark, Mlflow, and Databricks to identify potential cruise enthusiasts within the next three months. 

Augmented Design: I Led POC at Globant, focusing on detecting facial expressions using text, and images. Leveraged PyTorch, ResNet, Torch Audio, HuggingFace Transformers, and Amazon Transcribe to pioneer facial expression prototypes. Worked with datasets like Face Emotion Recognition (FER) and DISFA

Realogy: I was Responsible for developing a neural network to predict sales volume and identify potential franchisees for a prominent real estate company. Utilized  Spark SQL, Pyspark, and Databricks, to generate actionable insights contributing to business growth.
Overstock: I Designed and implemented a neural network for text summarization and Implemented a LSTM in PyTorch with Pyspark for data preprocessing, leveraging Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Novartis: I Participated in a POC with a pharmaceutical company to support dermatologists in the early detection of psoriasis-related changes.

Perubbean Supermarkets and Cencosud: I developed Recommender Systems based on collaborative filtering for two leading retail supermarket companies in South America. Utilized Pyspark and GCP to enhance the customer shopping experience.
experience.title: Data Scientist Senior Level II

experience.description:
* Designed and implemented predictive machine learning models for classification, optimizing business intelligence, and decision-making.
* Developed sentiment analysis pipelines for the Facebook and Twitter of Subway, utilizing Natural Language Processing (NLP), text mining, and feature engineering in R and Python (NLTK, Pandas, Numpy).
* Built data visualization dashboards using Tableau, Matplotlib, and Seaborn, enabling stakeholders to derive actionable insights from model outputs.
* Conducted model explainability and interpretability analysis, and Explainable AI techniques to communicate results to CEOs, data science teams, and business stakeholders.
* Implemented automated web scraping workflows using BeautifulSoup, Scrapy, and Selenium, extracting and preprocessing large-scale unstructured data for machine learning applications.
* Optimized feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning using Grid Search, Random Search, and Bayesian Optimization, improving model accuracy and performance.
experience.title: Data Scientist

experience.description:
Development of Supervised Predictive Models for Demand Planning:
Specialized in the development of predictive models for demand planning, I excel in data extraction and cleansing for forecast generation, as well as process mining. My expertise includes simulation and process optimization, combining supervised methods with time series for accurate forecasting.

Key Achievements:

Enhanced demand forecast accuracy by 15%, resulting in a 20% reduction in capital costs.
Successfully implemented Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) for the fuels, lubricants, additives, and filters product line.
Implemented the Economic Order Quantity (EOQ) inventory model, ensuring timely product replenishment and reducing inventory days from 44 to 21.
Proposed initiatives leading to a 24% reduction in warehouse labor costs and a 50% increase in loading and unloading efficiency.
Achieved a 15% improvement in perfect delivery indicators compared to 2015.
Applied Gattorna's supply chain configuration to align the supply strategy with the company's overall strategy, meeting customer expectations.
Proposed operational improvements for cement agencies in Neiva and Villavicencio, projecting a monthly profit increase of 15 million in Neiva and a 25% rise in deliveries in Villavicencio.
experience.title: Planning Coordinator

experience.description:
Roles and Responsibilities: 
My responsibilities encompass designing and implementing demand planning strategies, forecasting through time series analysis, and defining inventory and supply policies with a focus on service level considerations.
experience.title: Forcaster (freelance)

school.schoolName: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health

education.description:
Data Science Specialization with PhD Professors from Johns Hopkins University: Jeff Leek, Roger D. Peng & Brian Caffo

The specialization consists of 9 courses and a final project designed to prepare individuals with strong skills in data analysis and visualization, as well as the ability to develop predictive solutions. A solid understanding of statistical concepts and proficiency in programming environments like R are essential.

The courses included in the specialization are:

The Data Scientistâ€™s Toolbox
1. R Programming
2. Getting and Cleaning Data
3. Exploratory Data Analysis
4. Reproducible Research
5. Statistical Inference
6. Regression Models
7. Machine Learning
8. Developing Data Products
9. Final Data Science Project

publications.name: Capstone Project Word Predictor
publications.description:
It is a Data Science Project developed to predict the next word. The algoritm analyze the writing patterns of twitter, blogs and news.

https://gozalomoreno.shinyapps.io/mining_text_predictive/

The algoritm cleans data, builds ngrams with n=1,2,3 and applies concepts of Markov Chains and Conditional Probality to predict the next word.
http://rpubs.com/Gonzo25/211812

member.occupation: Data Scientist, Generative AI, NLP, LLM, MLOPS, Deep Learning, Machine Learning. AI Orchestration & Integration

publications.name: Predictive model of Jawbone up of Nike
publications.description:
http://rpubs.com/Gonzo25/94920
Using devices such as Jawbone Up, Nike FuelBand, and Fitbit it is now possible to collect a large amount of data about personal activity relatively inexpensively. These type of devices are part of the quantified self movement - a group of enthusiasts who take measurements about themselves regularly to improve their health, to find patterns in their behavior, or because they are tech geeks. One thing that people regularly do is quantify how much of a particular activity they do, but they rarely quantify how well they do it. In this project, your goal will be to use data from accelerometers on the belt, forearm, arm, and dumbell of 6 participants. They were asked to perform barbell lifts correctly and incorrectly in 5 different ways. More information is available from the website here: http://groupware.les.inf.puc-rio.br/har (see the section on the Weight Lifting Exercise Dataset)
